author: James Joyce
text: Dear Larbaud I rang up the hotel at S.Malo and they told me you had left for Paris. If you are really here can we dine any night this coming week at the Trianons with Arnold Bennett? He is at the Marignan and very desirous of meeting you again after so long as am I too. Herewith are a few pages of the French A.L.P. which may amuse you. Please bring them along. I hope you are well. I have not slept decently for a long time and my sight seems to have become temporarily much worse. With kind regards sincerely yours James Joyce
